Overview.WhoMayApplyText: • Current Career/Career-Conditional Department of Energy, Idaho Operations Office Employees
Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement:
OUR MISSION: The Idaho Operations Office is responsible for oversight of the Nation's premier national nuclear energy and related technology development laboratory. The work is on the leading edge of technology and has the potential for high, long-term payback in terms of national energy resource conservation, development, and management.

ABOUT THE AREA: We are located in Southeast Idaho and the surrounding area is an outdoor paradise. For more information, visit http://visitidahofalls.com/
Overview.JobSummary: The incumbent serves as the Supervisor for the Personnel Security and Physical Security Team. The incumbent oversees a technical and administrative staff assigned to accomplish projects in connection with all aspects of Personnel Security. Tasks and oversees contractors and provides input fixed price personnel security support services contract evaluations.  The incumbent also oversees physical security staff assigned as subject matter experts (SME) in area of Physical Security, Systems, Information Security, Foreign Visits and Assignments, and Program Management.
Overview.KeyRequirement: Must be a US citizen
Pre-employment drug testing may be required
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Q Clearance

Duties.MajorDuties: Exercises the full range of supervisory authorities and responsibilities.  Makes security clearance determinations for employees or other persons for access to sensitive information, resources, material, or work sites. Reviews and evaluates, in detail, reports of investigation (provided by the FBI, OPM, etc.) to ensure adequate investigative coverage.  Assigns duties to personnel security specialists to resolve conflicting information of a serious nature in clearance determinations.  Incumbent is responsible for assisting the Director, Security Division, in establishing and administering the physical security program for DOE-ID and the ID contractors.  The program includes physical security, systems, Information Security, Foreign Visits and Assignments, classification and declassification, export control, program management and procedures for handling violations of Federal, state, and local law and regulations at ID facilities and on the INL.

QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications:
Applicants must have at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade that provided them with the knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the duties of the position.  Specialized experience is experience serving as a technical authority in personnel or physical security; applying new theories and developments to unusual and complex security problems; evaluating personnel or physical security programs and administrative procedures for adequacy, efficiency and areas of improvement; or evaluating the impact of new security legislation or regulations on programs, missions and strategic plans.

Applicants must meet all qualification requirements, to include time-in-grade, within 30 days of the announcement closing.

HowToApplyInformation.HowToApply:
HOW TO APPLY

You must submit your completed online application by 11:59 pm Eastern Time on the closing date to be considered. You must apply online; paper applications will not be accepted. Requests for extensions will not be granted.

Steps to submit a complete application:

1. You must have a USAJOBS account and be logged in.

2. You must have a completed résumé. Please note that some DOE offices do not accept uploaded résumés and require that you have a completed résumé within your USAJOBS profile using the

Résumé Builder.

3. Once you are logged in and have your résumé completed, click the Apply Now button.

4. You must respond to all application assessment questions, carefully following any instructions provided.

5. You may then be asked to upload supporting documentation, which may include (but is not limited to): transcripts, portfolio samples, certifications, and other supporting documents.

6. IMPORTANT: In the final step of the application process you will be shown a copy of your resume and all the information you entered during the application process--YOU ARE NOT DONE JUST YET!

You must click the 'Finish' button at the bottom of this final page and receive confirmation that your application has been received. If you do not click 'Finish', your application will not be received. Your

USAJOBS status page may show a complete application even if you have not fully completed the final step of the application process.

If your résumé does not support the responses in your application questionnaire, or if you fail to submit required documentation BEFORE the vacancy closes, you may be rated 'ineligible', 'not qualified', or your score may be adjusted. INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.

NEED HELP?

If you experience any difficulties with the application process (anything after you have clicked the Apply Now button), please contact the HR Specialist listed on this announcement between normal business hours. If you are having trouble with USAJOBS (searching for jobs, account profile issues, or Résumé Builder help, please visit the USA Jobs Resource Center or e-mail USAJOBS3.0@opm.gov.

If you cannot apply online because of a disability, please contact the HR Specialist listed on this announcement during normal business hours.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: U.S. Department of Energy oversees the 586 sq mile Hanford Site located along the Columbia River in SE WA State. A plutonium production complex for 40 years, Hanford played a pivotal role in the nation's defense. Today, Hanford is engaged in one of the world's largest environmental cleanup projects. See more at:Hanford.gov or Youtube for the "Hanford Story." Come join us in our mission to return the land to beneficial use in a community that is "best-in-class": Tri-Cities
Overview.JobSummary: A successful candidate in this position will support a Special Assignment Project and lead a multi-disciplined team to develop criteria and evaluate submissions/proposals for laboratory acquisition.  Will functionally report to the Source Selection Official (SSO), and administratively reports to the Assistant Manager for Mission Support.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Source Selection Evaluation Board Chairperson, you will:  

  • Be responsible to a Source Evaluation Board (SEB) engaged in activities related to acquisition planning, contract solicitation and award for contract services. 
  • Coordinate the input and support of all concerned SEB parties.  Serving as a facilitator in the evaluation and selection process for the projects assigned. 
  • Be the principal agent providing coordination between the program managers, the contractors, and contracting officer for the SEB, you will brief RL and ORP senior management and senior DOE HQ officials on the status of acquisition efforts.

QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications:
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service. 

Creditable experience includes: Demonstrated use of quantitative and qualitative analytical and evaluative methodologies.  Knowledge of agency program goals and objectives, contract administrative, fiscal laws, and Federal Acquisition Regulations.  Ability to provide contract surveillance, technical direction, and administrative oversights of contracts.  Skill in designing and conducting comprehensive management studies, planning, organizing, and directing team study work and conducting negotiation with management.

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS

Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). You are NOT required to provide a separate narrative written response. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below.

  1. Mastery of quantitative and qualitative analytical and evaluative methodologies used to address complex organizational issues sufficient to develop new methodologies and/or theories where current approaches are obsolete or do not support evolving directions and strategies.
  2. Knowledge of agency program goals and objectives, the sequence and timing of key program events and milestones, and methods of evaluating the work of program accomplishments.
  3. Knowledge of contract administrative sufficient to oversee the work of an independent contractor who will provide input to the evaluation of the financial and business suitability issues to the offerors'.
  4. Knowledge of pertinent fiscal laws, Federal Acquisition Regulations, other regulations, policies, and precedents to plan, schedule, and evaluate contract services.
  5. Ability to provide contract surveillance, technical direction, and administrative oversight of contracts.
  6. Skill in designing and conducting comprehensive management studies, and preparing solutions to especially broad, important, and severe management problems.
  7. Skill in planning, organizing, and directing team study work, and effectively conducting critical negotiations with management.
  8. Ability to communicate effectively.  Ability to negotiate effectively with diverse groups to accept and implement recommendations where the proposals involve substantial agency resources, require extensive changes in established procedures, or resolve conflicts with the desires of the organization studied.

Time-in-Grade: Current Federal employees must meet time-in-grade requirements for consideration.

CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.

You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: This position is located in the Office of Health, Safety and Security (HSS). HSS is responsible for managing the operations of major staff organizations in the pursuit of continuous improvement in the safety and security posture of the Department of Energy especially in protecting the National Security. The HSS is seeking talented professionals to strengthen their technical ranks and, hopefully, to become their future leaders. To learn more about HSS, visit their web site at http://www.hss.doe.gov.
Overview.JobSummary:
This position is located in the Office of Technical Guidance (within the Office of Classification).  The Office of Technical Guidance develops, promulgates, and interprets national level policies, procedures, and guidance to identify (1) information that must be classified or controlled under statute or Executive order to protect the national security, to ensure the effective operation of the Government, or to protect the privacy interests of individuals and (2) classified or controlled information that may be declassified or decontrolled.

 

A successful candidate in this position provides direct administrative and program support to the Director, Office of Technical Guidance as well as the Director, Office of Classification. As a Program Specialist, the incumbent's duties include program analysis, planning, research, and liaison activities. The incumbent also provides administrative expertise, guidance, and direction for assigned areas of responsibility which impact directly on the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the Office of Classification.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Relocation is at your own expense.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Program Specialist, you will:

  • Provide assistance to the Director, Office of Classification, and to employees throughout the organization on specific aspects of DOE policy and Office of Classification program responsibilities.
  • Work with Confidential, Secret and/or Top Secret classified documents and packages.
  • Research and/or analyze problems, issues, or program/administrative issues.
  • Plan and conduct or lead ad-hoc teams in the conduct of special studies.
  • Oversee, analyze, and evaluate the office's implementation of the HSS electronic records system and recommends the development of modifications.
  • Serve as the primary administrative reviewer for the Office of Classification in the preparation and coordination of Congressional responses, testimony, and/or reports to upper management and the Secretary of Energy.
  • Receive incoming telephone calls and personal callers.
  • Keep the calendars and schedules appointments and meetings for the Director, Office of Classification and the Director of Technical Guidance without prior clearance.

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT FOR THIS VACANCY:

Eligible candidates for this position must be able to obtain and maintain a DOE Q clearance. The duties and responsibilities of this position require that the incumbent have access to documents and/or material containing Secret Restricted Data which are related to sensitive issues. Therefore, the position demands the highest degree of public trust and requires that the incumbent possess a DOE "Q" Clearance.

 

This position has also been designated as a Testing Designated Position (TDP) subject to testing for illegal drug use. The selectee must test negative prior to being appointed to this position and will be subject to random testing thereafter. Failure to pass or refusal to take subsequent tests could result in non- selection or disciplinary action, up to and including removal from the Federal service.

Overview.JobSummary:
The Office of Headquarters Personnel Security Operations manages and implements safeguards and security access authorization functions for DOE Headquarters as well as Government-wide requirements for DOE access authorizations (security clearances).  Responsibilities also include the classified visit program and electronic clearance processing.  Additionally, this Office is responsible for implementing the requirements of Homeland Security Presidential Directive 12 (HSPD-12) at DOE Headquarters.

 

A successful candidate in this position will oversee, manage, direct, and coordinate the HSPD–12 Personal Identity Verification (PIV) Team in the processing of HSPD–12 badge requests, pre-employment suitability checks, interim badge requests, and cases processed.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Relocation is at your own expense.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Personnel Security Specialist (Leader), you will:

  • Serve as the Lead Specialist for all operations carried out in the Headquarters HSPD–12 Personal Identity Verification Team, reporting directly to the Office Director on the status of workflow, special projects, and day-to-day tasks assigned to personnel on the team with recommendations to resolve any problems arising during the course of operations.
  • Act as Office Director in the absence of that official, and represents the Office Director in meetings and other interactions.
  • Provide direction, guidance and policy interpretation to personnel working in the adjudicative unit on all matters related to the processing of HSPD–12 PIV cases.
  • Oversee, manage, direct, and coordinates the HSPD–12 Personal Identity Verification (PIV) Team in the processing of HSPD–12 badge requests, pre-employment suitability checks, interim badge requests, and cases processed.
  • Conduct second and third tier review and evaluation of HSPD–12 PIV cases that contain derogatory information after first-tier review by a case screener or lower level specialist or second-tier review by the senior Personnel Security Specialist.
  • Process cases under the PIV appeal procedures as prescribed by DOE directive.
  • Prepare written evaluations of any derogatory and mitigating information found in investigative reports or otherwise in the HSPD–12 PIV file.

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service.  Specialized experience for this position is defined as experience with the principles and processes involved in HSPD–12 PIV applicable to Federal employees, contractor employees, and other individuals in order to review, evaluate and recommend concurrence/nonconcurrence of HSPD–12 PIV cases and to provide expert advice and technical assistance in HSPD–12 PIV program activities.

 

Time-in-Grade: Current Federal employees must meet time-in-grade requirements for consideration.

 

CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.

 

You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.

HowToApplyInformation.HowToApply:
To be considered for this position, you must submit a complete online application no later than 11:59pm (Eastern Time) on the closing date of this announcement. If you fail to submit a complete application prior to the closing time (regardless of when you started) the application system will not allow you to finish. Requests for extensions will not be granted so please begin the application process allowing yourself enough time to finish the application. Steps to submit a complete application:

  1. You must have a USAJOBS account and be logged in.
  2. You must have a completed résumé. Please note that some DOE offices do not accept uploaded résumés and require that you have a completed résumé within your USAJOBS profile using the Résumé Builder (click the link for more information).

  5. You will then be asked to upload supporting documentation, which may include (but is not limited to): transcripts, portfolio samples, certifications, and other supporting documents.

You must click the 'Finish' button at the bottom of this final page and receive confirmation that your application has been received. If you do not click 'Finish', your application will not be received. Your USAJOBS status page may show a complete application even if you have not fully completed the final step of the application process.

If your résumé does not support the responses in your application questionnaire, or if you fail to submit required documentation BEFORE the vacancy closes, you may be rated 'ineligible', 'not qualified', or your score may be adjusted. INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement:
The mission of the Office of Fossil Energy is to ensure that we can continue to rely on clean, affordable energy from our traditional fuel resources.  Fossil fuels supply 85% of the nation’s energy, and we are working on such priority projects as pollution-free coal plants, more productive oil and gas fields, and the continuing readiness of federal emergency oil stockpiles. 

 

As Director of the Management and Field Operations Office, has responsibility for management of human resources; training and development; and administrative activies including space, property, conferencing, awards, and travel.
Overview.JobSummary:
A successful candidate in this position will: 

  • Manage the activities of the Office.
  • Serve as organizational liaison on personnel issues and workforce diversity and administrative policy issues.
  • Direct activities in labor and employee relations, space utilization, property accountability, foreign and domestic travel, awards, and assure valid position and performance management. 
  • Coordinate organizational-wide affirmative action and EEO.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Relocation is at your own expense.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Supervisory Management Analyst, you will:

  • Serve as principal advisor on management, policy, and organizational issues affecting human resource management.
  • Supervise employees performing human resource and administrative services functions that include travel, training, office space, awards, and performance management.
  • Directs the development of workforce and succession plans to accomplish objectives identified in strategic plans and budget submissions.   
  • Develops human resource policies and procedures of the organization and provide guidance to program officials.
  • Evaluates human resource management activities effectiveness in providing customer service and achieving objectives
  • Serve as expert in human resource programs, policies, and operational issues.
  • Oversees the needs-based training program
  • Responsible for Intern and Diversity/minority programs.

  • Fostering Human Capital change in an organization
  • Provide supervisory and leadership skill in establishing and maintaining effective working relationship among staff members.
  • Performing workforce analysis of human capital programs and projects.

  • Knowledge of varied areas of human resource programs, policy, and operational issues. 
  • Ability to provide human resource management advisory services to employees and managers.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: DOE's overarching mission is to advance the national, economic, and energy security of the U.S. through scientific and technological innovation and the environmental cleanup of the national nuclear weapons complex. With DOE you'll have the flexibility and freedom to explore a world of possibilities through a wealth of exciting and challenging career opportunities. By joining DOE, you can hone your career skills while helping to secure the U.S. future and make a real difference in the lives of Americans and people around the world. To learn more about the DOE, please visit our website at the following link DOE.
Overview.JobSummary: The Department of Energy (DOE) Headquarters in Washington D.C. is seeking a highly-qualified candidate to serve as the Director, Office of Executive Resources in its Office of the Chief Human Capital Officer. This highly visible and challenging position is responsible for providing executive leadership and executive-level management advisory services for DOE’s executive human resources programs which include Senior Executive Service (SES), Senior Level (SL), Scientific and Professional (ST) and special excepted service positions as well as human resources support to political appointees and the Office of the Secretary.
Overview.KeyRequirement: U.S. Citizenship is required.
Position may involve some travel.
Designated and/or Random Drug Testing required
New appointees must successfully complete a 1 year probationary period.
Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret and/or Top Secret Clearance.
Executive Personnel Financial Disclosure required

Duties.MajorDuties: This position is located in the Office of the Chief Human Capital Officer and reports directly to the Director of Human Capital Management.  If selected for this position, you will oversee the development of policy and guidance and the daily execution of human resources support services for executive-level programs for DOE.  Lead the development and implementation of strategies and plans that address the management of the executive-level workforce across DOE and measure and monitor their effectiveness through program analysis and evaluation.  This includes position management, recruitment and staffing, classification, special incentives and awards, diversity, talent management, workforce development, performance management, pay and leave administration, employee relations and discipline, SES on-boarding and orientation, and the SES Candidate Development Program.  Provide strategic consulting services to senior leadership throughout DOE regarding the full range of executive management approaches to achieve the best and most efficient business practices and processes in acquiring, developing, and retaining a high performing career executive team within the context of governing Federal laws and regulations.  Serve as an Executive Advisor to DOE’s Executive Resources Board (ERB) and provide operational support to both the ERB and the Performance Review Board (PRB).  Represent DOE on a variety of human resources issues with interagency committees, Office of Management and Budget, Office of Personnel Management, and other Federal agencies and forums.

QualificationsAndEvaluation.Education: You are not required to submit education-related documents for this position.  However, you may submit a copy of your transcript(s), a separate course listing, or a course listing in the appropriate job specific question showing the type of information that appears on transcript(s) such as course title, department, hours earned (semester or quarter), and grade.  (Not required documents.)  If you have completed any part of your education outside of the U.S, you must submit the evaluation of your foreign education that has been prepared by an accredited organization.  The National Association of Credential Evaluation Services, NACES, can provide a list of who can evaluate your foreign education.  For additional information, visit DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.
QualificationsAndEvaluation.Requirements: CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT FOR THIS VACANCY: This is a career appointment in the SES. Unless the selectee is a member of the SES with career status or has successfully completed an SES Candidate Development Program, certified by the Office of Personnel Management, (OPM), your managerial qualifications must be approved by OPM before appointment can be effected.  If you are selected for this position, you will be subject to the U.S. Department of Energy mandatory requirements and will be required to file a public financial disclosure report within 30 days of entry on duty. As a condition of appointment to this position, you will be subject to pre-employment/pre-appointment testing for illegal drug use under the U.S. Department of Energy Employee Drug Plan.  If you are selected, you will be provided information regarding drug testing. Failure to undergo testing or positive findings resulting from the test will eliminate you from further consideration for this position. If selected for and appointed to this position, you will be subject to random drug testing while employed. New SES career appointees must successfully complete a 1 year probationary period.
QualificationsAndEvaluation.Evaluations:
You will be rated and ranked using only the information submitted for consideration. Applicants who do not demonstrate sufficient possession of the Executive Core Qualifications, (ECQs) factors and document demonstrated experience, training, and/or education in support of the technical qualifications by answering all of the questions for this vacancy announcement, will be ineligible for further consideration. Applicants will be evaluated on their narrative responses to the ECQs and all of the Mandatory Technical Qualifications (MTQs). The narrative must demonstrate the necessary level of skills, specialized knowledge, and technical competence that would indicate success at this level and must include clear and concise examples that emphasize the applicant's level of responsibilities, scope, and complexity. Please give a complete and detailed answer and do not enter "Refer to Resume" to explain your answer. Failure to adequately respond will result in an incomplete application, and you will not receive further consideration. Please refer to the reference guide indicated in the link below to ensure the proper procedures for submission are followed. For detailed guidance on ECQs, applicants are strongly encouraged to review the Office of Personnel Management's Guide to Executive Qualifications at SES RECRUITMENT/ECQ
To preview questions please click here.
QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications:
Applicants are required to submit a narrative statement for each of the five mandatory Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs) and each of the Mandatory Technical Qualifications (MTQs). Please give a complete and detailed answer for each mandatory qualification. Eligibility for this position will be based upon clearly demonstrating that the applicant has experience of the scope and quality sufficient to effectively carry out assignments of the position. Do not enter "Refer to Resume" to explain your answer. Applications directing the reviewer to search within the application or to "See Resume" are considered incomplete and WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED. In addition, applications that fail to provide a narrative statement or address any of the ECQs (if required) and/or MTQs are also considered incomplete and WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED. Applicants currently serving under a career Senior Executive Service (SES) appointment, eligible for reinstatement into SES, or have successfully completed a SES Candidate Development Program (CDP) approved by OPM are not required to address the ECQs but must address all  MTQs. Failure by non-SES members to address each of the required ECQ's and MTQ's statements will result in disqualification of your application. Your application must demonstrate that you possess these qualifications. Please provide examples that are clear, concise, and emphasize your level of responsibilities, the scope and complexity of programs managed, program accomplishments, policy initiatives undertaken, and level of contacts. All qualified candidates will be evaluated on the relevance of their experience, education, training, self-development, honors, awards, and outside activities. ALL applicants must respond to the following MTQ's which represent the experience needed to perform the duties and responsibilities of the position. You will be given the opportunity to address these MTQs later in the online application process.

MTQ 1.  Demonstrated ability to successfully advance agency-wide human resources/human capital (Executive Resources) management policies to a wide variety of internal and external customers by fostering communication and cooperation, and collaborating effectively with stakeholders and senior leadership to analyze complex program requirement issues, and recommend and implement innovative service delivery solutions that address organizational needs and support and Agency's strategic goals. 

MTQ 2.  Demonstrated agency-wide experience of comprehensive technical and administrative knowledge of all executive-level human resources (HR) functions sufficient to provide high-level analysis to determine whether products, services and programs are in compliance with policy, regulations and statutes and are responsive to organizational needs.

MTQ 3.  Knowledge and demonstrated experiences in solving complex problems and utilizing data analysis to lead a strategic approach for developing a culture of continuous improvement in the area of reliability, process cycle time, quality and productivity with the administration and delivery of agency-wide executive-level HR and human capital products and services. 

MTQ 4.  Experience which demonstrates the ability to direct an organization through subordinate supervisors and foster a success-oriented, accountable work environment and culture to execute agency-wide executive-level human resources/human capital management programs.   

 

Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs): Additional information regarding the following five ECQs listed below is available on the Office of Personnel Management's (OPM) Web site at SENIOR Executive SERVICE You will be given the opportunity to address these ECQs later in the online application process.

ECQ 1. LEADING CHANGE: Ability to bring about strategic change, both within and outside the organization, to meet organizational goals and establish an organizational vision and to implement it in a continuously changing environment.

ECQ 2. LEADING PEOPLE: Ability to lead people toward meeting the organization's vision, mission, and goals and provide an inclusive workplace that fosters the development of others, facilitates cooperation and teamwork, and supports constructive resolution of conflicts.

ECQ 3. RESULTS DRIVEN: Ability to meet organizational goals and customer expectations, and make decisions that produce high-quality results by applying technical knowledge, analyzing problems, and calculating risks.

ECQ 4. BUSINESS ACUMEN: Ability to manage human, financial, and information resources strategically.

ECQ 5. BUILDING COALITIONS: Ability to build coalitions internally and with other Federal agencies, State and local governments, nonprofit and private sector organizations, foreign governments, or international organizations to achieve common goals.

The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) is required by law to review the Executive Core Qualifications (ECQs) of each new career appointee to the Senior Executive Service (SES) prior to appointment.

Homeland Security Presidential Directive (HSPD-12):A selectee's appointment is contingent upon compliance with Homeland Security Presidential Directive (HSPD-12) governing personal identity.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: The Oak Ridge Office, located near Knoxville, Tennessee, is a component of the Office of Science Integrated Support Center.  Our mission is to provide administrative and technical services and expertise to DOE Science, Environmental Management, and Nuclear Energy Site Offices across the United States.  We also manage nearly 34,000 acres of Federally-owned land known as the Oak Ridge Reservation which is home to several major industrial complexes including the Oak Ridge National Laboratory, the East Tennessee Technology Park, and the Y-12 National Security Complex.

  • Provide expert financial and planning advice to ORO management and DOE Headquarters.

  • Prepare contractor appraisals for budget formulation and execution functions.
  • Review, analyze, and evaluate budget submissions of prime contractors and DOE offices.
  • Reconcile allocation and obligation balances between the local budget system and other source documents.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: The Oak Ridge Office, located near Knoxville, Tennessee, is a component of the Office of Science Integrated Support Center.  Our mission is to provide administrative and technical services and expertise to DOE Science, Environmental Management, and Nuclear Energy Site Offices across the United States.  We also manage nearly 34,000 acres of Federally-owned land known as the Oak Ridge Reservation which is home to several major industrial complexes including the Oak Ridge National Laboratory, the East Tennessee Technology Park, and the Y-12 National Security Complex.
Overview.JobSummary: A successful candidate in this position will serve as a Staff Accountant for the Financial Evaluation and Accountability Division supporting Oak Ridge Office (ORO) management in the overall administration of Department of Energy (DOE) programs and activities.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Relocation is at your own expense.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Staff Accountant, you will:

  • Provide expert accounting and auditing advice for the Oak Ridge Office and its customers.
  • Assist Contracting Officers in negotiating with contractors concerning unresolved cost proposals, allocation of costs, and allowability of costs.
  • Coordinate, interpret, and provide advice in resolving financial audit findings and Cost Accounting Standards noncompliance.
  • Negotiate complex cost and financial policy issues.
  • Conduct reviews of operations in the planning and execution of functional, financial, programmatic, and internal control reviews.
  • Assess and track corrective actions and status of recommendations.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: The Department of Energy's overarching mission is to advance the national, economic, and energy security of the U.S. through scientific and technological innovation and the environmental cleanup of the national nuclear weapons complex. With DOE you'll have the flexibility and freedom to explore a world of possibilities through a wealth of exciting and challenging career opportunities. You'll also hone your career skills while helping to secure the U.S. future and make a real difference in the lives of Americans and people around the world. To learn more about the DOE, please visit the following link DOE
Overview.JobSummary: This position is located in the Office of the Weatherization and Intergovernmental Programs Office within the Office of the Assistant Secretary for Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE). The mission of the Office of the Weatherization and Intergovernmental Program (WIP) is to promote the rapid adoption of energy efficiency and renewable energy technologies by a wide range of customers and stakeholders, including states, communities, institutions, companies and private citizens.  WIP's responsibilities include the Weatherization Assistance Program (WAP), State Energy Program (SEP), Energy Efficiency and Conservation Block Grant Program (EECBG), Tribal Energy Program (TEP).  The execution of WAP, SEP, and EECBG are conducted in partnership with the Project Management Center (PMC) located in the Golden Field Office and the National Energy Technology Lab (NETL).  The Office reports to the WIP Program Director.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
One year supervisory probationary period may be required
Some overnight travel required.
THIS POSITION IS NOT IN THE BARGAINING UNIT COVERED UNDER NTEU.
Relocation expenses may be paid.

Duties.MajorDuties:
Provides leadership, strategic direction, and executive program management of a financial assistance (grants) program with a budget of approximately $3 billion for the term of the Recovery Act under the direction of the Program Manager for OWIP, including operations management, program management, and all other roles associated with such a manager.  

Responsible for obligating then ensuring spending and completion of projects and activities associated with $3 Billion in Recovery Act spending.

Works with OWIP Program Manager and Assistant Secretary of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE) to develop specific requirements, long-term goals and objectives, and schedules for accomplishment of the OWIP programs, such as program and strategy review and assessment of program effectiveness and implementation.

Performs risk management analysis on the functioning of OWIP and restructures teams as needed to focus teams on accountability, responsibility, and overall Recovery Act targets.

Responsible for the appropriate and thorough monitoring of SEP grantees to ensure grantees are meeting the American Reinvestment and Recovery Act of 2009 (Recovery Act) objectives and goals

Oversees SEP budget, and works with budget team in developing, justifying, and allocating the budget and plans for OWIP assuring that the plans and funding requirements fully support and are consistent with legislative mandates, Recovery Act, and DOE goals and objectives.  

Responsible for ensuring grantees are spending Recovery Act funds well and completing activities by the grant dates; responsible for ensuring grantees have all the information and guidance needed to prevent or mitigate barriers to spending Recovery Act funds well and quickly.

Evaluates work performance of subordinates and appraises staff performance; provides advice, counsel, or instruction to employees on both work and administrative matters; interviews candidates for positions in the unit; and recommends appointment, promotion, or reassignment to such positions; hears and resolves complaints from employees.

Serves as expert on highly complex technical matters, and on issues pertaining to required resources at national and state levels.   Evaluates and makes authoritative technical judgments on issues pertaining to required resources.  Evaluates and makes authoritative judgments on proposals and alternative solutions to technical problems that have the effect of determining major direction in national policy and programs. Responsible for coordinating efforts in formulating all major management and technical decisions.  Provides direction, advice and expertise to Office personnel on legislative or regulatory developments/actions relating to DOE and other Federal agencies which potentially affect the organization.

Accomplishes special assignments for the Program Manager and may represent him/her both inside and outside of the agency to ensure an integrated and effective response to energy and energy conservation related issues and problems.

Coordinates effective communication between DOE headquarters, grantees, PMC, and parties involved in the timely and effective expenditure of Recovery Act funds. Collaborates with and manages other team members to assure activities, work processes and products are effectively integrated.

Contributes to improvements in team work processes and methods to deliver better and more cost-effective results to OWIP customers.  

Identifies projects, policies, trends, legislation, supply/demand, research and development capabilities, and other deployment barriers and opportunities and develops remedies to overcome these barriers.  

Collaborates with and supports the Assistant Secretary's Office, the Office of General Counsel, Office of Congressional and Intergovernmental Affairs, Office of Policy and International Affairs, Office of Public Affairs, Office of Business Administration, EERE technology deployment programs and other offices to achieve approved objectives.

QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications:
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service. 

Specialized experience for this position is defined as demonstrated experience with a broad range of state, local, and regional, energy efficiency and renewable energy policies and programs. (e.g., clean energy state and local lead-by-example programs, energy efficiency resource standards, disclosure policies, etc.) in terms of  their implementation and evaluation for the purposes of developing and advising the development of new energy efficiency and renewable programs and policies. Examples of this experience could include experience in the development of resource standards, demand-side management programs, distributed generation policies and programs, state and local energy planning, collaborative processes.  

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS

Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). Do not provide a separate narrative written statement. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below. Cite specific examples of employment or experience contained in your resume and describe how this experience has prepared you to successfully perform the duties of this position. DO NOT write "see resume" in your application!

1. Extensive knowledge of advanced concepts, principles, and practices of energy efficiency and renewable energy systems and technologies and related research and development, demonstration, and deployment initiatives.

2. Knowledge of government finance practices for energy efficiency and renewable energy across Federal, State and Local government.

3. Innovative knowledge and skill in program/project management techniques to serve as supervisor or manager of complex technological and field development programs.

4. Ability to apply experience and judgment to solve a variety of highly complex technical problems.

5. Knowledge of the Federal budget process, procedures, and requirements concerning the formulation, justification, and execution of program budgets.

6. Skill in written and oral communication to direct technology area activities, present professional papers, prepare reports and respond to congressional inquiries.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: The mission of the Office of Business Operations is to ensure the Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy (EERE) receives the operational support it needs to excel in the accomplishment of its mission.  The Office of the Business Operations proactively seeks to identify ways to strengthen EERE’s organization, operations, human capital, and project management while achieving significant cost savings.  The Office is led by the Chief Operations Officer and reports to the Assistant Secretary and Principal Deputy Assistant Secretary for Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy.
Overview.JobSummary:
This is a TERM position not to exceed 4 years.  Term Appointments do not confer competitive status and cannot be converted to permanent positions without further competition.  Term employees are eligible for health and life insurance, are covered under the Federal Employees Retirement System, and are eligible to participate in the Thrift Savings Plan. 

 

A successful candidate in this position will independently or through a multi-disciplinary team, leads IT projects in support of large-scale enterprise change initiatives.  The incumbent advises the ITS Director and senior leadership to advance IT services within the agency and to integrate multiple business areas or systems within EERE and with Departmental and Government-wide IT systems.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Information Technology (IT) Project Manager you will:

  • IT Project Management: Provides technical IT project management advice and coordination to manage the modification and new development efforts of numerous large scale software development efforts.  Typically the incumbent will lead teams in defining standard solutions, platforms, and best practices and runs multiple projects concurrently.  Teams brainstorm evaluate, and analyze potential improvements and technology pathways that may add value to existing systems and programs in support of advancing the agency's mission.  Identifies user requirements and assists with the design, development and documentation of business processes in IT systems under development.
  • IT expert and Advisory Services: As an expert in information technology, the incumbent provides advice and assistance to program managers, IT specialists and the ITS Director on a variety of areas including IT systems development projects from design to support and evaluating existing systems and services.  The incumbent advises on enterprise architecture issues to ensure compatibility of existing systems to planned improvements.
  • Customer Service and Client Support: Works with executive management, transformation change leaders, and stakeholders to identify, evaluate, mitigate and minimize risks associated with process changes and systems development.

Duties.MajorDuties:

1. Project Management:  Demonstrated skill in project planning and management, including strategic program planning and evaluation.

2. Skill in accomplishing work through others including making assignments and evaluating work results.

4. Oral communication:  Demonstrated ability to communicate orally including negotiating with affected parties such as agency customers or vendors and explaining technical information to a variety of audiences. 8. Written Communication:  Skill in preparing manuscripts which are explanatory, persuasive, or exploratory in nature for a variety of audiences.

10. Planning and analysis:  Applied knowledge of qualitative and quantitative methods and analytical skills to evaluate, respond to a broad range of issues, gather and analyze data, perform program or project evaluations, measurement studies, and other program-evaluation related issues.

A successful candidate in this position will independently or through a multi-disciplinary team, lead IT projects in support of large-scale enterprise change initiatives; advise leadership to advance IT services within the agency and to integrate multiple business areas or systems within EERE and with Departmental and Government-wide IT systems.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As an Information Technology (IT) Project Manager you will:

 

IT Project Management

  • Provides technical IT project management advice and coordination to manage the modification and new development efforts of numerous large scale software development efforts. 
  • Leads teams in defining standard solutions, platforms, and best practices and runs multiple projects concurrently, brainstorm evaluate, and analyze potential improvements and technology pathways that may add value to existing systems and program.
  • Identifies user requirements and assists with the design, development and documentation of business processes in IT systems under development.

IT expert and Advisory Services

  • As an expert in information technology,  provides advice and assistance on a variety of areas including IT systems development projects from design to support and evaluating existing systems and services. 
  • Advises on enterprise architecture issues to ensure compatibility of existing systems to planned improvements.

Customer Service and Client Support

  • Works with executive management, transformation change leaders, and stakeholders to identify, evaluate, mitigate and minimize risks associated with process changes and systems development.

QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications:
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service. Specialized experience for this position is defined as:

Experience in complex IT project management

EXAMPLES: Managing multiple projects concurrently; leading enterprise-wide change from multiple IT systems to an integrated IT architecture; Expertise in planning, executing, overseeing and reporting on IT projects; marketing, outreach, budget management for successful implementation of IT programs and initiatives; defining systems scope and objectives; collaborating with customers and stakeholders to develop requirements; and developing strategies to resolve project and technical issue

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS

Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). Do not provide a separate narrative written statement. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below. Cite specific examples of employment or experience contained in your resume and describe how this experience has prepared you to successfully perform the duties of this position. DO NOT write "see resume" in your application!

 

1.  Knowledge of IT systems and Project Management to lead the organization's efforts in developing technical solutions to support agency programs.

2.  Knowledge of Federal rules and regulations related to IT technology and cybersecurity.

3.  Knowledge of project management principles, methods and practices including ability to plan short and long range objectives, negotiate project commitments, prepare estimates and assign resources.

4.  Ability to develop project plans to implement short and long range goals in order to  meet project deadlines and resolve conflicts that may arise; and develop documents based on approved requirements.

5.  Ability to manage deliverables and work to verify they stay with scope coordinate project deviations; to determine corrective actions; and to coordinate and document revisions.

6.  Ability to lead multiple projects concurrently.

7.  Skill in identifying and understanding the business requirements of customer organizations.

8. Knowledge of software development practices and tools such as Structured Oriented Architecture (SOA), Microsoft Enterprise Patterns and Practices, Microsoft Visual Basic, Net, C#,XML, and JavaScript.

9.  Knowledge of the IT software lifecycle (design, requirements, development, production, maintenance).

10. Knowledge of cloud computing, including implementation of cloud-based application systems.

11.  Ability to communicate orally.

12.  Skill in developing written products that convey instructions and techincal information to a variety of audiences.

  • CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: The mission of the Office of Fossil Energy is to ensure that we can continue to rely on clean, affordable energy from our traditional fuel resources.  Fossil fuels supply 85% of the nation’s energy, and we are working on such priority projects as pollution-free coal plants, more productive oil and gas fields, and the continuing readiness of federal emergency oil stockpiles.
Overview.JobSummary:
The Fossil Energy's Office of Management and Field Operation is responsible for labor and employee relations, position classification and staffing, performance management, employee recognition, training, space utilization, directives,  property accountability, and travel oversight, workforce diversity, and Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) plans. 

 

 

A successful candidate in this position will: 

  • Administering a career development program that provides employee assessment, courses, training, mentoring, and counseling;
  • Advocate diversity, EEO and affirmative action by ensuring FE capitalizes on the strengths and expertise of minorities, people with disabilities, and females in professional positions. 
  • Establishes FE policy to implement and promote non-discrimination and affirmative action plans. 
  • Works in partnership with senior Office managers and the Office of Human Capital to establish and promote an ongoing learning environment to optimize FE's efforts to acquire and sustain a vital and effective diverse workforce.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Relocation is at your own expense.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Training and Diversity Specialist, you will:

  • Plan, administer, and evaluate an employee development program.
  • Plan, administer, and evaluate a new employee orientation program.
  • Assess employees engaged in complex work (i.e., Information technology, science and engineering) to determine intermediate and long-range training needs.  
  • Provide career guidance to employees and facilitate a mentoring program.
  • Conduct systematic studies/surveys and analyze data obtained. 
  • Conduct analysis to develop and implement a workforce diversity and inclusion program.
  • Plan and develop diversity outreach strategies to improve minority and diversity recruitment.   
  • Administer a summer internship program utilizing innovative strategies to attract diverse applicants.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: The Department of Energy's overarching mission is to advance the national, economic, and energy security of the U.S. through scientific and technological innovation and the environmental cleanup of the national nuclear weapons complex. With DOE you'll have the flexibility and freedom to explore a world of possibilities through a wealth of exciting and challenging career opportunities. By joining DOE, you can hone your career skills while helping to secure the U.S. future and make a real difference in the lives of Americans and people around the world. Please visit our website the following link DOE
Overview.JobSummary:
The Office of Legacy Management (OLM), reporting directly to the Under Secretary for Nuclear Security, manages the Department’s legacy responsibilities resulting from the nuclear weapons program.  The mission of the Office is to protect human health and the environment through effective and efficient long-term surveillance and maintenance; to preserve and protect legacy records and information; to support an effective and efficient workforce structured to accomplish departmental missions; to implement Departmental policy concerning continuity of worker pension and medical benefits; to manage legacy land and assets, emphasizing safety, reuse, and disposition; to mitigate community impacts resulting from the cleanup of legacy waste and changing departmental missions; and to actively provide and coordinate policy issues with appropriate Departmental organizations.

 

This position is located in the Office of Business Operations (OBO), Planning, Budget and Acquisition Team and provides procurement support to the Office of Legacy Management and reports to the OBO Director, through the PBA Team Leader.
Overview.KeyRequirement: Relocation expenses will not be paid.
U.S. Citizenship is required.
Position IS in the Bargaining Unit covered under NTEU
Background and/or Security Investigation is required.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Business Management Specialist, you will:

 

  • GS-11,  The incumbent supports the Office Director and staff by providing information on and recommendations for approaches, policies, and techniques designed to establish consistency and compatibility among office acquisitiion activities including lessons learned, specific contract clauses, financing methods, solicitation evaluation criteria, negotiations issues and strategies, performance specifications, statement of work, soliciatation documents etc.               
  • GS-12, Advises the Office Director and staff on approaches, policies, and techniques designed to establish consistency and compatibility among office acquisition activities including lessons learned, specific contract clauses, financing methods, solicitation evaluation criteria, negotiation issues and strategies, performance specifications, statements of work, solicitation documents, etc.    
  • GS-13, Serves as Technical Monitor or COR for the OLM contracts and as the primary technical monitor for all negotiated task orders; gives primary technical direction to support contractors; ensures Independent Government Estimates for technical scope associated with task orders are complete; provides performance metrics for identifying and measuring contractor performance award fee; makes recommendations to LM senior management concerning evaluations of contractor change notices and task order proposals for contract acceptability.

GS-12 The incumbent for this position must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 level in federal service performing the same type of work or closely related duties such as providing technical monitor for contracts; providing technical support on innovative business practices regarding contracts; developing metrics for tracking and measuring contract performance; developing acquisition plans for multi-year, long-term and/or high value projects; and tracking and ensuring the achievement of mandated socio-economic goals. GS-13 The incumbent for this position must have at least one (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-12 level in federal service performing the same type of work or closely related duties such as serving as a technical monitor on contracts; providing technical support on innovative business practices regarding contracts; developing metrics for tracking and measuring contract performance; providing technical direction/guidance on contract tasks such as implementation, reporting, and problem solving; developing acquisition plans for multi-year, long-term and/or high value projects; and tracking and ensuring the achievement of mandated socio-economic goals. ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS: Your online resume must demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs/Competencies) (NOTE: Applicants need not prepare a written responses to these KSAs/competencies, unless asked in the online application): 1. Knowledge acquisition planning. 2. Skill performing technical support to management on innovative business practices. 3. Ability to develop performance metrics. 4. Skill analyzing acquisition assistance requests.

Overview.JobSummary:
This vacancy is located in the Southwestern Power Administration (SWPA), Office of Corporate Services, Human Resources Management Division in Tulsa, Oklahoma. The SWPA, a sub-agency of DOE, delivers the most reliable and clean wholesale hydroelectric power benefiting 9 million users, across a six-state region, at the lowest possible cost.  The Human Resources (HR) Management Division is responsible for providing the full range of human capital service delivery for SWPA managers and employees in  
   --staffing and recruitment,
   --position classification, and
   --day-to-day operational support.

A successful candidate in this Human Resources Specialist position will perform comprehensive HR management advisory and technical services in the areas of  
   --position classification and management,
   --recruitment and placement, 
   --compensation, and
   --a variety of other substantive organizational functions.

THIS POSITION CAN BE FILLED AT EITHER THE GS-09 OR GS-11, AND IF FILLED AT THE GS-09 LEVEL, THERE IS NON-COMPETITIVE PROMOTION POTENTIAL TO THE GS-11 LEVEL.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Relocation expenses may be paid in accordance with DOE regulations.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Human Resources Specialist, you will:

  • Advise managers on position classification and management matters including realignment of function/duties; classify/certify PDs and prepare evaluation statements.
  • Perform comprehensive recruitment activities, including merit promotion, delegated examining and direct hire for a variety of positions.
  • Perform job analysis, working closesly with subject matter experts on effective methods of evaluating candidates.
  • Advise managers on basic pay setting, incentives, overtime, and/or leave entitlement questions or issues, alternate work schedules and telework.
  • Advise managers and employes of OWCP process and/or problems.
  • Execute a wide range of HR information systems, data bases, and retrieval methods to accomplish HR processes and provide data for HR reports.

QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications:
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service. Specialized experience for this position is defined as experience
providing advice and policy interpretation to managers on Federal HR management issues, including:

  1. Applying Federal staffing and classification concepts, practices, policies, precedents, and procedures to HR issues;
  2. Independently preparing vacancy announcements, assessment tools, and job analyses and screening applicants for eligibility;
  3. Applying pay and leave administration laws, regulations, principles and practices to technical issues; and
  4. Classifying positions, preparing evaluation statements, and preparing desk audits.

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS

Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). You are NOT required to provide a separate narrative written response. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below.

  1. Knowledge of and skill in applying a wide range of classification and position management regulations, principles, concepts, practices and techniques.
  2. Knowledge of and skill in applying a wide range of staffing and recruitment laws, Executive Orders, regulations, policies, concepts and practices.
  3. Knowledge of and skill in applying a wide range of pay and leave administration laws, regulations, principles, and practices. 
  4. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. 

Time-in-Grade: Current Federal employees must meet time-in-grade requirements for consideration
CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.
You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.

Overview.JobSummary:
This vacancy is located in the Southwestern Power Administration (SWPA), Office of Corporate Services, Human Resources Management Division in Tulsa, Oklahoma. The SWPA, a sub-agency of DOE, delivers the most reliable and clean wholesale hydroelectric power benefiting 9 million users, across a six-state region, at the lowest possible cost.  The Human Resources (HR) Management Division is responsible for providing the full range of human capital service delivery for SWPA managers and employees in  
   --staffing and recruitment,
   --position classification, and
   --day-to-day operational support.

A successful candidate in this Human Resources Specialist position will perform comprehensive HR management advisory and technical services in the areas of  
   --position classification and management,
   --recruitment and placement, 
   --compensation, and
   --a variety of other substantive organizational functions.

THIS POSITION CAN BE FILLED AT EITHER THE GS-09 OR GS-11, AND IF FILLED AT THE GS-09 LEVEL, THERE IS NON-COMPETITIVE PROMOTION POTENTIAL TO THE GS-11 LEVEL.
Overview.KeyRequirement: You must be a United States Citizen.
This employer participates in the e-Verify program.
Relocation expenses may be paid in accordance with DOE regulations.
See "Other Information" section regarding Selective Service requirements.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Human Resources Specialist, you will:

  • Advise managers on position classification and management matters including realignment of function/duties; classify/certify PDs and prepare evaluation statements.
  • Perform comprehensive recruitment activities, including merit promotion, delegated examining and direct hire for a variety of positions.
  • Perform job analysis, working closesly with subject matter experts on effective methods of evaluating candidates.
  • Advise managers on basic pay setting, incentives, overtime, and/or leave entitlement questions or issues, alternate work schedules and telework.
  • Advise managers and employes of OWCP process and/or problems.
  • Execute a wide range of HR information systems, data bases, and retrieval methods to accomplish HR processes and provide data for HR reports.

Your application will be rated by our application system using the Category Rating procedure. A quality review will then be conducted by the HR Office and/or Subject Matter Expert (SME). Your application is rated based on the extent and quality of your experience, education (if applicable to the job), and training described in your online résumé/questionnaire as related to the duties of this position. The quality categories are usually defined as "Best Qualified", "Well Qualified" and "Qualified". Within each category, veteran preference eligibles will be listed at the top of the category. CP/CPS veterans are placed at the top of the highest category for all positions except professional and scientific positions at GS-9 and below.

QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications:
SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

A qualified candidate's online application and resume must demonstrate at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level in the Federal service. Specialized experience for this position is defined as experience
providing advice and policy interpretation to managers on Federal HR management issues, including:

  1. Applying Federal staffing and classification concepts, practices, policies, precedents, and procedures to HR issues;
  2. Independently preparing vacancy announcements, assessment tools, and job analyses and screening applicants for eligibility;
  3. Applying pay and leave administration laws, regulations, principles and practices to technical issues; and
  4. Classifying positions, preparing evaluation statements, and preparing desk audits.

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS
Your application and resume should demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills and abilities (KSAs). Do NOT provide a separate narrative written response. Rather, you must describe in your application how your past work experience demonstrates that you possess the KSAs identified below.

  1. Knowledge of and skill in applying a wide range of classification and position management regulations, principles, concepts, practices and techniques.
  2. Knowledge of and skill in applying a wide range of staffing and recruitment laws, Executive Orders, regulations, policies, concepts and practices.
  3. Knowledge of and skill in applying a wide range of pay and leave administration laws, regulations, principles, and practices. 
  4. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. 

Time-in-Grade: Current Federal employees must meet time-in-grade requirements for consideration
CTAP/ICTAP candidates: To be considered "well qualified" you must meet all of the requirements as described in this section.
You must meet all qualifications and eligibility requirements by the closing date of this announcement.

Overview.AgencyMarketingStatement: The Department of Energy's overarching mission is to advance the national, economic, and energy security of the U.S. through scientific and technological innovation and environmental cleanup of the national nuclear weapons complex. With DOE you'll have the flexibility and freedom to explore a world of possibilities through a wealth of exciting and challenging career opportunities. By joining DOE, you can hone your career skills while helping to secure the U.S. future and make a real difference in the lives of Americans and people around the world. To learn more about the DOE, visit our website at DOE.
Overview.JobSummary:
The Office of Legacy Management (LM), reporting directly to the Under Secretary for Nuclear Security, manages the Department’s legacy responsibilities resulting from the nuclear weapons program.  The mission of the Office is to protect human health and the environment through effective and efficient long-term surveillance and maintenance; to preserve and protect legacy records and information; to support an effective and efficient work force structured to accomplish departmental missions; to implement Departmental policy concerning continuity of worker pension and medical benefits; to manage legacy land and assets, emphasizing safety, reuse, and disposition; to mitigate community impacts resulting from the cleanup of legacy waste and changing departmental missions; and to actively provide and coordinate policy issues with appropriate Departmental organizations.

 

This position is located in the Office of Business Operations (OBO), Planning, Budget, and Acquisition (PBA) Team and provides budget support to the Office of Legacy Management

and reports to the PBA Team Leader.
Overview.KeyRequirement: U.S. Citizenship is required.
Background and/or Security Investigation is required.
THIS POSITION IS IN THE BARGAINING UNIT COVERED UNDER NTEU.
Relocation expenses will not be paid.

Duties.MajorDuties:
As a Budget Analyst, you will:

  • GS-13, Plan, organize, and carry out budgeting activities involving substantive national programs conducted by the Department under annual, multi- and no-year appropriations. Provide advice and control functions on all phases of appropriated funds budgeting (i.e., budget formulation, presentation and execution) to program secretarial officers and DOE principals.
  • GS-14, Serve as the expert lead and focal point for formulation and execution of a complex program direction and program budget for LM, taking into consideration overall DOE and LM goals and objectives and establishes working relationships within LM, DOE, external organizations (Congressional staff, OMB, etc.), other government agencies as necessary, and with DOE field offices.

Supporting documentation of your education and training is appreciated, even though not required for this position. Please fax all supporting documents in accordance with the instructions provided under Required Documents in the "How to Apply" section.

If selected for this vacancy, you may be required to file the OGE Form 450 (Financial Disclosure Statement).
QualificationsAndEvaluation.Evaluations:
Your application will be rated based on the extent and quality of your experience, education, and training described in your online resume/questionnaire as related to the duties of this position. If your resume is incomplete, or does not support the responses in your online questionnaire you may be rated ineligible, not qualified, or your score may be adjusted.
To preview questions please click here.
QualificationsAndEvaluation.Qualifications: Online resumes of qualified candidates must describe at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade in the Federal Government. Specialized experience is defined as experience in any of the phases of budget administration (formulation, presentation/enactment, and execution) when such work required knowledge and skill in applying budget-related laws, regulations, policies, precedents, methods and techniques. The experience must have provided the particular knowledge, skills and abilities to successfully perform the duties described in this vacancy announcement. Examples of specialized experience include planning and/or carrying out budget formulation, presentation and/or execution for one or more substantive national programs; advising on or ensuring the adequacy and accuracy of budget documentation submitted for Departmental, OMB, and/or Congressional review; researching and presenting budget issues based on analysis of program resource requirements; generating a variety of written documents, reports, etc., to communicate detailed financial information; and explaining, recommending or providing guidance on financial and budgetary or statutory requirements, policies, and procedures. GS-13 Level: At least one year of the specialized experience must have been equivalent to the GS-12 level in the Federal Government. GS-14 Level: At least one year of the specialized experience must have been equivalent to the GS-13 level in the Federal Government. ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS: Your online resume must demonstrate that you possess the following knowledge, skills, and abilities (KSAs/Competencies) (NOTE: Applicants need not prepare a written response to these KSAs/competencies, unless asked in the online application): 1. Knowledge of all phases of budget administration. 2. Knowledge of the laws, regulations, concepts, and procedures governing planning, budgeting, and acquisition programs. 3. Ability to develop and present complex financial data to a variety of audiences. 4. Ability to develop budget strategies in anticipation of and reaction to fast breaking financial situations.

HowToApplyInformation.HowToApply: 1.) Submit an online resume and respond to the job specific questions. Apply online at USAJOBS. 2.) If you are unable to apply online, call the Human Resources Specialist listed in the announcement between the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Eastern Standard Time (EST). 3.) Submit all required documents by 11:59 p.m. EST on the closing date of the announcement in order to receive consideration.
HowToApplyInformation.RequiredDocuments: 1. SUBMIT YOUR COMPLETED APPLICATION WHICH INCLUDES YOUR RESUME, YOUR RESPONSES TO ALL ONLINE ASSESSMENT QUESTIONS, and all required supplemental documents in order to be considered. 2. CURRENT FEDERAL EMPLOYEES/REINSTATEMENT ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS: YOU MUST SUBMIT AN SF-50, NOTIFICATION OF PERSONNEL ACTION, DOCUMENTING PROOF OF COMPETITIVE STATUS, TENURE, GRADE LEVEL AND STEP. ALL NON-COMPETITIVE ELIGIBLE APPLICANTS MUST SUBMIT PROOF OF ELIGIBILITY (I.E., SF-50 DOCUMENTING THE FULL PERFORMANCE LEVEL OF A POSITION HELD ON A PERMANENT BASIS). 3. Veterans: If you are eligible for veteran's preference, you must indicate the type of preference you are claiming. All veterans MUST submit a DD-214, member 4 copy. If claiming 10-point preference you must also submit a SF-15 and any other proof that you are eligible for 10-point preference. If you are currently on active duty, you must submit an official statement of service from your command or other official documentation that proves your military service was performed under honorable conditions. You can find additional information on veteran's preference at VET GUIDE. 4. Education: You must submit a copy of your transcript(s), a separate course listing, or a course listing in the appropriate job specific question showing the type of information that appears on transcript(s)such as course title, department, hours earned semester or quarter), and grade. 5. If you have completed any part of your education outside of the U.S., you must submit the evaluation of your foreign education that has been prepared by an accredited organization. The National Association of Credential Evaluation Services (NACES). NACES can provide a list of who can evaluate your foreign education. For additional information, visit DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. 6. If you believe that you are Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP)eligible, please visit ICTAP/CTAP for additional information. To be considered well qualified, you must have a score of 85. 7. If you are eligible for any Special Appointing Authority, you must submit the documentation supporting your eligibility. For additional information, visit DISABILITY RESOURCES. 8. The documentation identified above must be attached to your application using one of the following actions: 1) "Upload" to upload documents directly from your computer 2)" USAJOBS" to upload documents stored in your "USAJOBS" account 3) "Fax" to generate a fax cover sheet and fax the documents (system generated cover sheet must be used) Applicants will be prompted at the "Vacancy Documents" section of the application to add their required documents. Please review and follow the instructions listed to successfully submit your documents.
HowToApplyInformation.WhatToExpectNext: You may check your application status any time after the announcement closes. USAJOBS has added an alert setting to the system to drive status updates notification for applicants. We recommend that you update your USAJOBS profile to receive these status updates via email after the announcement closes. We will continue to update your status online as changes are made.
